descriptions.autoplay: Sounds automatically play with one click.
descriptions.autoplay next: Sounds automatically advance to a next sound.
descriptions.gps traces: GPS traces are actually visible as paths on the map for mobile recordings.
descriptions.live streaming: Map includes sounds that are streamed live.
descriptions.mixing: Map can play multiple sounds at the same time.
descriptions.mobile: Has an application on a mobile device.
descriptions.point-and-click: Interaction follows the typical point-click-and-listen cycle.
descriptions.heatmap: Some sort of heatmap is visible for an additional data layer.
descriptions.images: Images are shown along with the sound.
descriptions.spectrogram: A spectrogram of the sound currently playing is visible.
descriptions.videos: Videos of the place recorded / the recording itself are available.
descriptions.additional map layers: Map layers besides the standard map / satellite / hybrid views are available, such as historical data.
descriptions.commercial: Sound map is a commercial product.
descriptions.crowdsourced: Map includes the ability (even via email) for community contribution.
descriptions.field recordings: Map allows inclusion of field recordings.
descriptions.music only: Sounds are limited to only what would traditionally be described as music.
descriptions.speech: Speech content, including descriptions, poetry, etc.
descriptions.categories: Sounds are organized in some sort of discrete categorization or taxonomy.
descriptions.descriptions: Sounds contain some sort of text-based description of their content.
descriptions.visualizations: Other audio feature visualizations besides spectrogram/waveforms.
descriptions.platform: Tool has a primary use of being used as a platform for other users to create their own maps and/or archives.
